column4: Hi. I just got a new laptop... a Dell Studio 1735... For some reason, Ubuntu's live CD wont boot on it. It continually throws buffer errors on sr0, and after a while it goes to a shell displaying "BusyBox". If I <CTRL>+D out of the shell, the system reboots.
sounds like a bad dvd, know I've seen BusyBox as an "error" before but trying to recall how I got past it
have you used this ubuntu cd before?
Nope. I'm going to check it for defects...
